channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-5788] FuseOnEAP in offline mode throws exception- The matching wildcard is strict, but no declaration can be found for element 'jee:jndi-lookup'.
item.description:
• Issue appears in offline mode. User has environment with no access to internet.
  • With internet connectivity available issue doesn't appear.
item.summary: FuseOnEAP in offline mode throws exception- The matching wildcard is strict, but no declaration can be found for element 'jee:jndi-lookup'.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Yeah, it looks like this [1] fixes the issue. I confirmed that the issue doesn't happen with the latest fuse-on-eap 6.3.0 #131 build. Probably simply backporting the fix should resolve it for 6.2.x as well.

[1] https://github.com/wildfly-extras/wildfly-camel/issues/1224
OK, let's mark it as resolved then. Please file a PATCH JIRA if we really need the fix to be backported to 6.2.x.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
• Unzip the project and build it using `mvn clean install`
  • In offline mode(no internet connectivity) deploy war file to $ {JBOSS_HOME}

    /standalone/deployments

  • Start EAP, check logs.
  • There should be error in logs 

    08:58:01,821 WARN  [org.wildfly.extension.camel.SpringCamelContextFactory$1] (MSC service thread 1-2) Ignored XML validation warning: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException; lineNumber: 10; columnNumber: 78; schema_reference.4: Failed to read schema document 'http://www.springframework.org/schema/jee/spring-jee.xsd', because 1) could not find the document; 2) the document could not be read; 3) the root element of the document is not <xsd:schema>.
